security_audit.summary: No malicious patterns observed. Scripts perform local filesystem operations for skill initialization, validation, and packaging as documented.

low_findings.title: Packages all files under skill folder
low_findings.description: The packager zips every file under the provided skill directory. If the folder contains unintended sensitive files, they will be included in the .skill artifact. This is expected behavior but can lead to accidental data leakage during distribution if users misplace secrets inside the skill folder.

low_findings.title: Writes files without explicit encoding
low_findings.description: write_text() uses platform default encoding unless specified. Low security impact, but can cause inconsistent behavior across environments and potentially break validation/packaging if non-UTF8 defaults are used.

low_findings.title: Unused os import
low_findings.description: Unused import is not a security issue, but it is a minor hygiene issue that can confuse reviewers and static analyzers.

content.value_statement: Stop guessing how to structure a Claude skill. Follow a clear workflow to initialize, validate, and package skills consistently.
actual_capabilities: Provide a structured guide for writing SKILL.md with metadata and best practices
Initialize a new skill folder with SKILL.md plus scripts/references/assets examples via scripts/init/skill.py
Validate SKILL.md frontmatter for required fields and allowed properties via scripts/quick/validate.py
Package a skill directory into a distributable .skill zip after validation via scripts/package/skill.py
Offer reference patterns for workflows and output formatting in references/workflows.md and references/output-patterns.md
limitations: Does not generate a complete domain-specific skill without your requirements and examples
Validator checks only basic SKILL.md frontmatter rules, not full functional correctness of bundled scripts
Packager includes all files under the skill folder, so you must keep secrets out of the directory
Does not publish or install the packaged skill automatically

prompt_templates.title: Beginner: Define Triggers
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me write the SKILL.md frontmatter for a skill named "customer-support-triage". Ask 3 questions to clarify what should trigger the skill, then propose a concise description.

prompt_templates.title: Intermediate: Draft Structure
prompt_templates.prompt: Given this skill goal: "analyze CSV exports and flag anomalies", propose a workflow-based SKILL.md outline with section headings and what to put in each section.

prompt_templates.title: Advanced: Resource Planning
prompt_templates.prompt: For a skill that edits DOCX files with tracked changes, list what should go into scripts/, references/, and assets/. Include file names and what each file should contain.

prompt_templates.title: Expert: Release Checklist
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a packaging checklist for my skill folder: what to validate in SKILL.md, what files to exclude, and how to confirm the .skill zip contains only intended content.

output_examples.input: I want a skill for onboarding new engineers to our repo. What should the SKILL.md include?
output: Proposes a short YAML description that lists trigger phrases and scenarios
Recommends a workflow-based structure with onboarding steps
Suggests a references/ file for repo conventions and common commands
Suggests a scripts/ helper for environment checks if needed
Lists what not to include to keep the skill lean

best_practices: Start with real user examples to define triggers and scope
Keep SKILL.md concise and move large details into references/
Validate and package only after removing any accidental sensitive files
anti_patterns: Avoid adding extra docs like README.md or changelogs that do not help execution
Avoid vague frontmatter descriptions that do not specify when the skill should trigger
Avoid bundling credentials, tokens, or private configuration inside the skill directory

faq.question: What is this skill compatible with?
faq.answer: It is guidance plus helper scripts for creating a SKILL.md-based skill folder and packaging it into a .skill zip artifact.

faq.question: What are the limits of the validator?
faq.answer: It checks basic SKILL.md YAML frontmatter format, required fields, allowed keys, and simple name/description rules. It does not prove the bundled scripts are correct.

faq.question: Can I integrate this into a CI pipeline?
faq.answer: Yes. Run the validation script on skill folders and run the packaging script to produce .skill artifacts as build outputs.

faq.question: Is my data safe when packaging?
faq.answer: Packaging is local, but the packager will include every file in the skill folder. Keep secrets out of that directory before creating or sharing the .skill file.

faq.question: Troubleshooting: validation fails with YAML errors. What do I do?
faq.answer: Ensure SKILL.md starts with a YAML frontmatter block delimited by --- lines, and that name and description are plain strings without unexpected keys.

faq.question: How does this compare to writing a skill manually?
faq.answer: It provides a consistent template, proven structure patterns, and a repeatable validate-and-package flow so you make fewer formatting and distribution mistakes.
